intro: Cybianthus nestorii, commonly known as the Maori daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Cybianthus nestorii is known for its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions, including strong winds and salt spray. Its historical significance to the Māori people adds to its cultural and botanical importance.
